title.narrative: OUPUT 2.1.1: ACCESS TO BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: Institutions at central, regional, and local levels have strengthened capacity to improve the effectiveness, efficiency, quality, and resilience of the education system for girls and boys in the most disadvantaged regions, including children living with disabilities, which contributes to Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral - Conflict Prevention, Fragility And Peacebuilding, Evaluation, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid), Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Digital Transformation, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Risk-Informed Humanitarian And Development Nexus Programming, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, girls and boys of school age (4â€“19 years), particularly the most disadvantaged, have access to quality education and training and acquire basic skills.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Institutions at central, regional, and local levels have strengthened capacity to improve the effectiveness, efficiency, quality,and resilience of the education system for girls and boys in the most disadvantaged regions, including children living withdisabilities

description.narrative: In 2021 the CO supported Ministry of Education (MoE) efforts to improve access to quality education, primarily through the: distribution of learning materials to 452,122 children, construction of 103 additional classrooms, improvement of the digital learning platform and development of new learning tools. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2022
